tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE product_returns (
  return_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  product_name VARCHAR(255),
  return_reason VARCHAR(255),
  return_date DATE,
  customer_name VARCHAR(255),
  customer_email VARCHAR(255),
  return_status VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE product_returns (
    return_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    product_id INT,
    return_date DATE,
    customer_id INT,
    return_reason TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE reverse_logistics (
    logistics_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    return_id INT,
    return_date DATE,
    shipping_company TEXT,
    return_status TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE ReturnLogistics (
    logistics_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    return_id INT,
    return_date DATE,
    carrier VARCHAR(100),
    shipped_from VARCHAR(100),
    delivered_to VARCHAR(100)
);

CREATE TABLE ReturnAnalysis (
    analysis_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    return_id INT,
    analysis_date DATE,
    analysis_result VARCHAR(1000),
    analyst VARCHAR(255)
);

CREATE TABLE Returns (
  return_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  product_id INT,
  return_date DATE,
  return_reason VARCHAR(255),
  customer_id INT
);

CREATE TABLE Logistics (
  logistics_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  return_id INT,
  return_status VARCHAR(50),
  return_processing_date DATE,
  return_method VARCHAR(50)
);

CREATE TABLE Returns (
    return_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    product_id INT,
    return_reason TEXT,
    return_date DATE,
    FOREIGN KEY (product_id) REFERENCES Products(product_id)
);

CREATE TABLE ReturnStatus (
    status_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    return_id INT,
    status VARCHAR(50),
    update_date TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (return_id) REFERENCES Returns(return_id)
);

CREATE TABLE Logistics (
    logistics_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    return_id INT,
    logistics_company VARCHAR(100),
    tracking_number VARCHAR(20),
    delivery_status VARCHAR(50),
    FOREIGN KEY (return_id) REFERENCES Returns(return_id)
);
